Description: Body sherd of black-figured North Ionian pottery amphora (?); interior reserved; exterior: white slip; upper part of African (eye white with red iris) looking left, body frontal (?), left arm preserved to below elbow, right arm preserved to mid-upper arm, wearing fitted garment with a incised wavy line down the middle and double incised lines at the elbow; incised line around head and for shoulders and top line of arms.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis) (on Petrie 1886 pl. V)
Curator's comments: Lemos and Walter-Karydi incorrectly identify the sherd as Chian.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.33)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 51, pl. V, no. 41)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (pl. 100, 819)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 335, no. 1657, pl. 220)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.026)
